summary.en: ToMic is a Web-based LAN virtual microphone tool that turns your phone into a PC microphone via browser. It streams audio over Wi-Fi using WebSocket and Opus encoding, then routes it through virtual sound cards (e.g., BlackHole or VB-CABLE) for low-latency input in apps like Zoom, Teams, or Discord. No app installation required on mobile, with native support for macOS and Windows.

With material libraries, document crawlers, and triple-review mechanisms, it helps users produce highly authentic content with low AI detection rates, preserving human voice and personal details.

It unifies 200+ data sources via SQL-compatible syntax, enabling conversational analytics and semantic search across structured and unstructured data.

With features like automated workflows and Ghost(Pro) managed hosting, it's ideal for creators and publishers seeking a developer-friendly, scalable platform.

metadata.name: enableAppleAI

summary.en: This tool enables Apple Intelligence on Macs sold in Mainland China by bypassing regional restrictions via system cache modification and eligibilityd process injection, tested on macOS 15.4+ and 26.1+. It requires no persistent background services and offers two methods: Method 1 (lldb injection + file locking) and Method 2 (direct plist editing), with an added option to force region change to US for advanced features like ChatGPT integration, compatible with M1+ chips.

metadata.name: mcp-chrome

summary.en: Chrome MCP Server is a Chrome extension-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes browser functionality to AI assistants like Claude, enabling complex automation, content analysis, and semantic search. metadata.name: GPT-SoVITS

summary.en: GPT-SoVITS is a powerful few-shot voice cloning and text-to-speech WebUI that enables zero-shot and few-shot TTS training with just 1 minute of audio data. It supports cross-lingual synthesis in Chinese, English, Japanese, Korean, and more, featuring integrated tools for voice separation, ASR, and dataset preparation.

summary.en: MCP Feedback Enhanced is an enhanced MCP server designed for AI-assisted development, featuring dual interface support (Web UI and cross-platform desktop app) with intelligent environment detection and feedback-driven workflows to reduce platform costs and boost development efficiency.

metadata.name: gallery

summary.en: Google AI Edge Gallery is an experimental app showcasing on-device ML/GenAI use cases, enabling users to run generative AI models locally on Android and iOS. summary.en: This project demonstrates a fullstack application using React frontend and a LangGraph-powered backend agent to perform comprehensive web research via dynamic query generation, Google Search integration, reflective reasoning, and iterative refinement using Google's Gemini models, ultimately producing cited answers from gathered sources.

summary.en: Deep Research is an AI-powered tool for lightning-fast in-depth research, supporting multiple LLMs (e.g., Gemini, OpenAI, Anthropic) and search engines. It generates comprehensive reports in ~2 minutes using Thinking and Task models, with local knowledge base, knowledge graph, content editing, and full privacy via on-device processing.

It supports multi-image uploads, text feedback, and a Chinese GUI with a 700x800px interface. Installable via uvx, it enhances AI-human interaction in tools like Claude Desktop.

metadata.name: Open-Sora
metadata.description: Open-Sora: Democratizing Efficient Video Production for All

summary.zh: Open-Sora æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¼€æºçš„é«˜æ•ˆè§†é¢‘ç”Ÿæˆé¡¹ç›®ï¼Œè‡´åŠ›äºé™ä½é«˜è´¨é‡è§†é¢‘åˆ¶ä½œçš„æŠ€æœ¯é—¨æ§›ã€‚å…¶æ ¸å¿ƒäº®ç‚¹åŒ…æ‹¬11Bå‚æ•°æ¨¡å‹åœ¨VBenchå’Œäººç±»åå¥½æµ‹è¯•ä¸­ä¸é¡¶å°–æ¨¡å‹æ€§èƒ½ç›¸å½“ï¼Œä»…éœ€20ä¸‡ç¾å…ƒæˆæœ¬å³å¯è®­ç»ƒï¼Œå¹¶å®Œå…¨å¼€æ”¾æƒé‡ä¸ä»£ç ã€‚æ”¯æŒä»1Båˆ°11Bå¤šè§„æ¨¡æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œç»“åˆ3D-VAEã€rectified flowç­‰åˆ›æ–°æ¶æ„ï¼Œæ˜¾è‘—æå‡ç”Ÿæˆè´¨é‡ä¸æ•ˆç‡ã€‚
summary.en: Open-Sora is an open-source initiative for efficient high-quality video generation, democratizing access to advanced video creation. Its 11B model matches top-tier performance on VBench and human preference tests at just $200K training cost, with full checkpoint and code transparency. Featuring scalable architectures like 3D-VAE and rectified flow, it enables accessible, high-fidelity video production across model sizes from 1B to 11B.

summary.en: Spark-TTS is an efficient LLM-based text-to-speech model using Qwen2.5 for high-quality, bilingual (Chinese/English) speech synthesis. summary.en: meDisplay is a cross-platform screen mirroring tool that turns any browser-equipped device (e.g., Android tablet) into a secondary display for Mac, mimicking Apple's Sidecar. Also supports Windows/Linux X11 mirroring, auto-rotation, fullscreen toggle, and ADB-based Android wired connection for seamless multi-screen workflows.

summary.en: This project implements a diffusion model for automatic colorization of black-and-white images using the LAB color space, where only the color channels are noised and predicted. It supports recording screens, windows, apps, and mobile devices with features like driver-free audio loopback, mouse highlighting, and screen magnifier. summary.en: wxauto is a Windows-based automation tool for the WeChat desktop client (non-web version) using UIAutomation technology. It integrates with leading LLMs including DeepSeek, Grok, Claude, Ollama, Gemini, and OpenAI. It emphasizes personal data ownership, enabling users to manage their digital footprints. The project aims to integrate AI for building personal memory data centers, including smart photo albums and annual report generation.

It features simple plain-text syntax, easy extensibility via Python-based libraries, and cross-platform support, backed by a rich ecosystem of tools and resources.

summary.en: EasySpider is a completely free visual no-code web crawler and browser automation tool that enables users to design and execute data collection tasks through a graphical interface without programming. It automatically detects similar elements on web pages, supports batch data extraction, and can also run via command line for integration into other systems, ideal for e-commerce scraping and automation testing.

summary.en: This project explores AI applications in programming, painting, and writing through StableDiffusion image generation, ChatGPT text creation, and GitHub Copilot code assistance. It systematically analyzes how AI models interact with human input via prompt engineering for image description, article structuring, and code generation, proposing the concept of 'prompt programming' as a bridge between natural language and software development.

Users can create custom plugins in TypeScript to connect any AI service, with default Stability API plugin requiring an API key.

summary.en: EasyExcel is a high-performance Java tool for reading and writing Excel files, developed by Alibaba. Capable of processing a 75MB Excel file (460K rows) in just 23 seconds using only 16MB RAM, it supports templates, export, and ultra-fast mode, offering a simple API and comprehensive documentation for enterprise-scale data handling.

summary.en: YApi is a powerful, user-friendly, and efficient visual API management platform designed for developers, product managers, and QA teams. summary.en: MAMA2 is an open-source project designed to resolve overheating issues in MacBooks when watching online videos by replacing Flash players with HTML5 Video. It includes tools for AJAX, logging, and cross-domain requests, with a local development environment using Node.js and Gulp. Community contributions are encouraged to expand site support.

summary.en: An unofficial Bilibili desktop client for macOS, built on mpv with hardware decoding and libass-based danmaku rendering. This enables high-performance execution via a Go-based runtime library, offering a viable alternative for deploying Python applications with native speed.

summary.en: ProxyChains-NG is a modern successor to the original proxychains project, intercepting socket calls in dynamically linked programs via LD_PRELOAD to route traffic through SOCKS4/5 or HTTP proxies. It supports Linux, BSD, macOS, and other platforms, featuring IPv6, DNAT, and multithreading optimizations. Designed for bypassing network restrictions, it requires careful configuration and legal awareness.

summary.en: IPProxyPool is an open-source proxy IP pool project supporting Python 2/3, offering automated collection and validation of anonymous, high-anonymity, and transparent proxy IPs. It uses multi-threaded crawlers to gather proxies from multiple sources, filters them via a scoring system, and supports HTTP/HTTPS protocols with geographic filtering. Built on SQLAlchemy ORM, it defaults to SQLite but can be extended to MySQL or MongoDB. A RESTful API enables external access for use in web scraping and data collection applications.

summary.en: Django SSL Server is a development-only SSL-enabled server for Django, supporting self-signed and CA-trusted certificates, ideal for local HTTPS testing during development, though not recommended for production use.

It integrates map services, weather, articles, and uses platforms like Amap, Qiniu Cloud, WeChat, and Aliyun for rapid deployment of a practical mobile solution.

summary.en: GB/T 2260 is the Chinese national standard for administrative division codes, providing complete coding data for counties and above-level administrative regions. It supports multi-language implementations (Python, JavaScript, Ruby, Java, PHP, Go, Elixir, Swift, C#) and is ideal for GIS, address parsing, and data analysis applications with authoritative and regularly updated sources.

summary.en: Electronic WeChat is an Electron-based cross-platform WeChat client for macOS and Linux, replicating all Web WeChat features including message recall blocking and sticker support. It offers native-like experience with optimizations like direct URL access and drag-and-drop file sharing. Though discontinued, it serves as an excellent reference for Electron desktop app development.

metadata.name: frp
metadata.description: A fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the internet.

summary.zh: frp æ˜¯ä¸€æ¬¾é«˜æ€§èƒ½åå‘ä»£ç†å·¥å…·ï¼Œä¸“ä¸ºç©¿é€ NAT æˆ–é˜²ç«å¢™è®¾è®¡ï¼Œæ”¯æŒ TCPã€UDPã€HTTPã€HTTPS åè®®è½¬å‘ï¼Œæä¾› P2P è¿æ¥æ¨¡å¼ã€‚å…·å¤‡å¤šåè®®æ”¯æŒã€è‡ªå®šä¹‰åŸŸåè®¿é—®å†…ç½‘æœåŠ¡ã€SSH ç©¿é€ã€HTTP æ–‡ä»¶æœåŠ¡å™¨æš´éœ²ã€HTTPS åŠ å¯†è½¬å‘ã€ç§æœ‰æœåŠ¡æš´éœ²ã€Prometheus ç›‘æ§ã€å®¢æˆ·ç«¯è®¤è¯ç­‰æ ¸å¿ƒåŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºè¿œç¨‹å¼€å‘ã€å†…ç½‘æœåŠ¡è®¿é—®ã€IoT è®¾å¤‡è¿æ¥ç­‰åœºæ™¯ã€‚
summary.en: frp is a high-performance reverse proxy designed to expose local servers behind NAT or firewalls to the internet. It supports TCP, UDP, HTTP, and HTTPS protocols, with P2P connectivity. Key features include multi-protocol forwarding, custom domain access to internal services, SSH tunneling, HTTP file server exposure, HTTPS encryption, private service exposure, Prometheus monitoring, and client authentication, ideal for remote development and IoT access.

summary.en: A React Native-based Sudoku game featuring animations, editing mode, game resume, and online leaderboards. The developer holds a personal record of 3:43 and plans to add multiple difficulty levels, i18n support, and cloud-based score storage.

summary.en: Lumen is a macOS menu bar app that automatically adjusts screen brightness based on displayed content. It learns user preferences via brightness keys, brightening the screen for dark content (e.g., terminal) and dimming it for light content (e.g., web pages), offering a more comfortable viewing experience, especially at night.

summary.en: The React Native Learning Guide is a comprehensive Chinese resource hub compiling tutorials, open-source apps, components, tools, and official documentation for React Native development, covering everything from beginner guides to native module integration for cross-platform mobile app creation.

metadata.name: serpy
metadata.description: ridiculously fast object serialization

summary.zh: serpy æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæè‡´å¿«é€Ÿçš„ Python å¯¹è±¡åºåˆ—åŒ–æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œä¸“ä¸ºé«˜æ€§èƒ½åœºæ™¯è®¾è®¡ã€‚å®ƒæ”¯æŒå°†å¤æ‚æ•°æ®ç±»å‹ï¼ˆå¦‚ Django æ¨¡å‹ã€è‡ªå®šä¹‰ç±»ï¼‰é«˜æ•ˆè½¬æ¢ä¸ºåŸç”Ÿç±»å‹ï¼ˆå­—å…¸ã€åˆ—è¡¨ç­‰ï¼‰ï¼Œå¹¶æ˜“äºè½¬ä¸º JSONã€‚ç›¸æ¯” marshmallow æˆ– Django REST Frameworkï¼Œå…¶æ€§èƒ½ä¼˜åŠ¿å¯è¾¾ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°é‡çº§ä»¥ä¸Šï¼ŒåŒæ—¶ä¿æŒç®€æ´çš„ç±»ç»§æ‰¿å¼æ¶æ„å’Œé«˜åº¦å¯å®šåˆ¶æ€§ã€‚
summary.en: serpy is a ridiculously fast object serialization framework for Python, optimized for high performance. It efficiently converts complex data types (e.g., Django models, custom classes) into native Python types (dicts, lists), easily convertible to JSON. It outperforms alternatives like marshmallow or Django REST Framework by an order of magnitude, while offering a clean, extensible class-based design with minimal code duplication.

summary.en: html-json-forms is a Python implementation of the HTML JSON Forms specification, enabling structured JSON submission via traditional HTML forms using array-style naming (e.g., items[0][name]). It supports nested object parsing, integrates with Django REST Framework via JSONFormSerializer, and provides both functional parsing and DRF-compatible serializers for complex form data handling.

It enables switching between scenes with customizable icons, badges, and titles, compatible with React Native 0.16+. Ideal for building native-like tab navigation interfaces.

summary.en: ZeroNet is a decentralized web platform using Bitcoin cryptography and the BitTorrent network for censorship-resistant, peer-to-peer hosting. Sites run on users' devices, support real-time updates, .bit domains, Tor anonymity, and automatic peer discovery without relying on central servers.

summary.en: file_sync is a lightweight automation tool that monitors file modifications in the background and automatically pushes changes to a Git repository, enabling real-time synchronization and version tracking of configuration files. summary.en: Project Babel 2 is an open-source community platform built with Python on Google App Engine, designed for sharing and discovery communities like V2EX. It features node-based organization, responsive themes, WebDAV avatars, Atom feeds, HTML5 support, MapReduce data optimization, and Twitter OAuth integration, capable of scaling to millions of daily pageviews with proper configuration.

summary.en: Django Persistent Messages is a Django app extending the built-in messages framework to support persistent user notifications. It stores messages in the database for authenticated users, enabling sticky reminders until marked read. Anonymous users use session storage. Offers unified API for display and email notifications, fully compatible with Django's native messaging system.

summary.en: Django Persistent Messages extends Django's messaging framework to provide persistent message storage for authenticated users via database, with features like mark-as-read, delete, and reply. Anonymous users retain session-based messages. Offers a unified API combining persistent and temporary messaging.

summary.en: Django Monitio is a unified, persistent messaging system for Django that stores messages in the database and delivers live updates via Server-Sent Events (SSE). Built on Redis and compatible with modern browsers, it enables real-time notifications while supporting both authenticated and anonymous users.

It dynamically adds classes to control visibility, supports multiple animation modifiers (e.g., slide, fade), and offers a flexible API with custom events for use in sliders, tabs, and more.

summary.en: ShadowsocksR Droid is an Android 4.0+ client for ShadowsocksR, compatible with Shadowsocks protocol and supporting some ShadowsocksR features. Built with Kotlin and Java, it offers a cross-platform network proxy solution for enhanced privacy and access.

summary.en: The Chinese translation of 'Parallel Programming with Python' is a comprehensive guide covering core concepts, algorithms, and tools for concurrent, parallel, and distributed programming in Python. It addresses GIL limitations, communication patterns, and parallel design techniques like divide-and-conquer and data decomposition, with practical examples such as Fibonacci computation and web scraping to demonstrate parallelizable problems and multi-core/distributed acceleration.

metadata.name: winauth

summary.en: WinAuth is an open-source, portable authenticator for Windows that supports RFC 6238 (TOTP) and HOTP-based 2FA codes. It integrates authenticators for Battle.net, Steam, Guild Wars 2, SWTOR, and major cryptocurrency exchanges like Coinbase and Bitstamp. Features include password protection, machine binding, YubiKey support, hotkey controls, portable mode, and import/export via UriKeyFormat, enabling secure and unified two-factor authentication management.

Compatible with modern browsers, it offers flexible configuration and callbacks for mobile photo editing workflows.

summary.en: WebUploader is a modern file uploader built primarily on HTML5 with Flash fallback, supporting IE6+ and mobile browsers. It enables chunked concurrent uploads, image preview/compression, drag-and-drop/paste file addition, MD5 instant upload, and modular extensibility for enhanced performance and flexibility.

summary.zh: COW æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåŸºäº Go ç¼–å†™çš„æ™ºèƒ½ HTTP ä»£ç†å·¥å…·ï¼Œä¸“ä¸ºç®€åŒ–ç§‘å­¦ä¸Šç½‘è®¾è®¡ã€‚å®ƒèƒ½è‡ªåŠ¨è¯†åˆ«è¢«å¢™ç½‘ç«™å¹¶ä»…å¯¹è¿™äº›ç½‘ç«™å¯ç”¨äºŒçº§ä»£ç†ï¼ˆå¦‚ Shadowsocksã€SOCKS5 ç­‰ï¼‰ï¼Œç›´è¿ç½‘ç«™åˆ™ç»•è¿‡ä»£ç†ä»¥æå‡è®¿é—®é€Ÿåº¦ã€‚æ”¯æŒå¤šç±»å‹äºŒçº§ä»£ç†ã€è´Ÿè½½å‡è¡¡ã€PAC è‡ªåŠ¨é…ç½®åŠè®¿é—®è¡Œä¸ºå­¦ä¹ ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºç§»åŠ¨è®¾å¤‡æˆ– APN ä»£ç†åœºæ™¯ã€‚
summary.en: COW (Climb Over the Wall) is an intelligent HTTP proxy written in Go, designed to simplify bypassing internet restrictions. It automatically detects blocked websites and routes only those through secondary proxies (e.g., Shadowsocks, SOCKS5), while allowing direct access to uncensored sites for optimal speed. Features include multi-proxy support, load balancing, PAC generation, and adaptive learning of site accessibility patterns.

summary.en: PyTime is a user-friendly Python module designed to handle date/time/datetime operations via string input. It parses irregular date formats (e.g., '2015.5.17', 'NOV21th2015') and supports natural-language-like timedelta calculations (e.g., '2years 3mon'). metadata.name: django-mobile

summary.en: django-mobile is a Django middleware that detects mobile browsers and serves different templates accordingly. It uses middleware to identify device type, then transparently loads flavored templates (e.g., mobile/index.html) based on the detected 'flavour', enabling responsive design without altering view logic. It supports multiple mobile flavors and graceful fallback to default templates.

summary.en: Bootswatch offers a collection of open-source themes for Bootstrap, enabling easy integration via pre-compiled CSS, CDN, Sass imports, npm packages, or Ruby Gem. It supports theme customization and variable overrides for rapid UI enhancement.

summary.en: metro-bootstrap is a Metro-styled theme built on Twitter Bootstrap, offering a modern flat UI design. It supports easy integration via npm, Git clone, or CDN, includes precompiled CSS and FontAwesome fonts, ideal for quickly building Windows Metro-style web applications.

summary.en: DjangoVerifyCode is a Django-based library for generating captcha images with English words or numbers, featuring adaptive font sizing and validation, ideal for user authentication in web applications.

summary.en: bootstrap3-validation.js is a jQuery plugin designed for Bootstrap 3 form validation, supporting built-in rules (e.g., email, URL, date, number), custom validation logic, asynchronous checks, IE8 compatibility, and clean HTML attribute-based configuration for horizontal and inline forms.

summary.en: mui is a high-performance framework for mobile HTML5 apps, addressing core issues like page flickering, poor animations, and unsmooth pull-to-refresh. It delivers near-native app experiences with rich UI components and seamless integration with HBuilder, enabling efficient development of smooth, visually appealing mobile web applications.

summary.en: Web RPA is a powerful visual automation tool enabling zero-code workflow creation via drag-and-drop. It supports web scraping, form filling, and testing with 273 built-in modules across browser automation, data processing, database operations, media handling, PDF conversion, and document transformation. Built on FastAPI + React, it offers smart search, Mermaid flowcharts, variable autocompletion, and full non-commercial free usage.
